official_title: A Phase III Trial of Lomustine-Temozolomide Combination Therapy Versus Standard Temozolomide in Patients With Methylated MGMT Promoter Glioblastoma
brief_title: Testing the Addition of the Chemotherapy Drug Lomustine (Gleostine) to the Usual Treatment (Temozolomide and Radiation Therapy) for Newly Diagnosed MGMT Methylated Glioblastoma
cancer_type_display: A study for patients with newly diagnosed glioblastoma that has a methylated MGMT promoter.
prior_treatments_excluded: Targeted therapy for GBM or lower grade glioma

key_inclusion_summary: Histopathologically proven diagnosis of glioblastoma or gliosarcoma.
MGMT promoter must be methylated, confirmed by central pathology review.
Karnofsky Performance Status (KPS) of 70 or greater.
key_exclusion_summary: Prior therapy for tumor except for resection or laser interstitial thermal therapy (LITT), including prior chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or targeted therapy.
Definitive clinical or radiologic evidence of metastatic disease outside the brain.
Prior invasive malignancy unless disease free for a minimum of 2 years.
Pregnancy or unwillingness to discontinue nursing.
